BR_text.BRsummary: some missing config params in Learning-Environment-Create-New.md
BR_text.BRdescription:
Describe the bug
 I'am on the "release_1" tag and try to get the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/ml-agents/blob/release_1/docs/Learning-Environment-Create-New.md>Learning-Environment-Create-New</denchmark-link>
  running.
 But in rollerball_config.yaml there are two missing params, Sequence_length and memory_size.
 I looked into the other demos and set it to:
 
 sequence_length: 64
 memory_size: 128
 
 I'am also had to change the Behaviour Style from Heuristic to Default. I think that is also missing in that tutorial.
 To Reproduce
 Done the example.
 Console logs / stack traces
 <denchmark-code>mlagents.trainers.exception.UnityTrainerException: The hyper-parameter sequence_length could not be found for the <class 'mlagents.trainers.ppo.trainer.PPOTrainer'> trainer of brain RollerBall.
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-code>mlagents.trainers.exception.UnityTrainerException: The hyper-parameter memory_size could not be found for the <class 'mlagents.trainers.ppo.trainer.PPOTrainer'> trainer of brain RollerBall.
 </denchmark-code>
 
 Environment (please complete the following information):
 
 Unity Version: 2019.3.11
 Windows 10
 ml-agents: 0.16.0,
 ml-agents-envs: 0.16.0,
 Communicator API: 1.0.0,
 TensorFlow: 2.2.0

comments_0.comment_text:
Additionally, please fix:
 <denchmark-code>reward_signals:
     extrinsic:
     strength: 1.0
     gamma: 0.99
 </denchmark-code>
 
 should be:
 <denchmark-code>reward_signals:
     extrinsic:
         strength: 1.0
         gamma: 0.99
 </denchmark-code>

comments_1.comment_text:
Hi all.
 This should be fixed now on the last version of master. Thanks for calling it out though.

comments_2.comment_text:
Do you mean in:  <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/ml-agents/blob/master/docs/Learning-Environment-Create-New.md>https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/ml-agents/blob/master/docs/Learning-Environment-Create-New.md</denchmark-link>
  ?
 I still see the same error:
 reward_signals:
 extrinsic:
 strength: 1.0
 gamma: 0.99

comments_3.comment_text:
Thanks for pointing this out, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/DanTulovsky>@DanTulovsky</denchmark-link>
 
 I was thinking of the original issue. What you bring up also needs to be addressed though. I will make a PR to do so right now.

comments_4.comment_text: Closing this, as the original issues have been fixed.
